text: ['3.2.3  Export prohibitions and licensing', '3.52.  Exports of the following items are prohibited: arms and ammunition; pornographic articles; antiques;  all  kinds  of  narcotic  drugs  and  psychotropic  substances19;  crude  oil  (from  2013);  and raw logs (to be prohibited from 1 April 2014).20', '3.53.  According to the authorities, Myanmar does not use export quotas.', '3.54.  It  would  appear  that  the  Government  is  restructuring  its  export  licensing  regime.  The authorities state that, from 2013 152 types of goods no longer require export licences; no further information  was  available.  Exporters  of  other  goods  still  require  export  licences  for  export.  To apply  for  an  export  licence,  exporters  must  submit  an  application  form  and  a  sales  contract, invoice;  the  Ministry  of  Commerce  issues  export  licences  within  24  hours.  Licences  are  valid  for three  months,  renewable  but  not  transferable.  Unlike  for  import  licences,  there  is  no  export licensing fee.', '3.55.  A recommendation is required from the relevant department/ministry in order to obtain an export licence for certain commodities (Table 3.7).', 'Table 3.7 Export permit Commodity Agricultural seeds Teak scantlings and forest products Shrimp bran (prawn shell dust), fish bran Metal  Religious commodities Movies, video tapes Animals, animal products and animals feed Materials related to food and drugs Seeds and vegetable roots  Pearl products made of pearl and mother of pearl', 'Source:', 'Information provided by the authorities.', 'Ministry / Department Ministry of Agriculture and Irrigation Ministry of Environmental Conservation and Forestry Livestock Breeding and Veterinary Department Ministry of Mines Religious Affairs Department Motion Picture Enterprise Livestock Breeding and Veterinary Department Food and Drug Administration Ministry of Agriculture and Irrigation Myanmar Pearl Enterprise', '3.56.  The  time  required  to  obtain  a  permit  depends  on  the  type  of  commodity.  For  example,  it takes from 6 months to 18 months to obtain recommendations from the FDA on materials related to food and drugs, while it takes from 1 week to 10 days to obtain SPS certificates.']
